judges: HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA Present
judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF PUNJAB AND HARYANA
AT CHANDIGARH
Criminal Revision No. 62 of 1997
Date of decision: 3rd March, 2009
Swaran Singh 
   Petitioner
Versus 
State of Punjab and others
  Respondents
CORAM: 
HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA
Present: 
Mr. T.S. Sangha, Advocate for the petitioner. 
Mr. Mehardeep Singh, Assistant Advocate General Punjab for
the State. 
KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA, J. 

Present revision petition has been filed to assail acquittal of
Harbhajan Singh, Surjit Kaur, Kamaljit Singh and Sukhdeep Kaur. A further
prayer has been made that Amar Iqbal Singh should be sentenced under
Section 302 IPC and not under Section 304-B IPC. 
The accused respondents No.2 to 6 were tried in case FIR
No. 11 dated 24.01.1993 registered at Police Station Division No.4,
Ludhiana under Sections 302, 304-B, 306, 511 and 120-B IPC. Trial Court
acquitted all the accused under Section 302 IPC and also recorded
acquittal of respondents No. 3 to 6 for other offences. 
Accused respondent No.2 Amar Iqbal Singh had preferred
Criminal Appeal No. 684-SB of 1996, in which his conviction under Section
-B IPC has been upheld. No State appeal has been filed. 
Criminal Revision No. 62 of 1997
The order passed in Criminal Appeal No. 684-SB of 1996 be
read as part of this order. 
In view of the order passed in Criminal Appeal No. 684-SB of
, no separate orders are called for. 
Accordingly, present revision petition stands disposed off. 
 [KANWALJIT SINGH AHLUWALIA]
JUDGE 
March 3, 2009
rps
